alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued September 30 at 8:20PM MDT until October 01 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 6000 feet elevation. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches above 6000 feet, with higher amounts over the higher peaks. Rain may mix with or become snow times as low as 5000 feet, but little to no accumulation is expected there. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Backcountry recreation conditions will be cold and raw due to rain and snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The more intense snow bands may drive snow levels down below 6000 feet at times, especially late tonight, but accumulating snow is generally expected to stay above pass level.
info.instruction: Outdoor recreationists should be prepared for early winter conditions. The cold and wet weather may result in hypothermia for those not properly dressed. Snowfall may impact some roads, mainly making them wet and slick.
